name: Dark Elf Raiders
background:
The Dark Elf Raiders are disparate gangs formed by surviving members of the underclass after the Elven Empire collapsed. They rely on the mobility of their small raiding parties and advanced anti-gravity skimmers to make up for their lack of heavy armor.

Abandoned by their ruling class during the Robot Legion uprising, handfuls of the Elvish lower classes managed to escape into space. These surviving Elves formed gangs, ready to do whatever it takes to survive. Bitter and distrustful of outsiders, the Gangs persist, taking what they need from outsiders to ensure that they can never be betrayed again.
backgroundFull:
The Elven Empire was once a dominant power within the Sirius Sector, possessing both advanced psychic abilities and highly advanced technology, and Elven society was strictly governed by a psychically-gifted nobility. As their society developed and spread, the Elven nobility began to develop Robots in order to fulfill more and more roles in their society, until most menial labour was performed by them. More and more Elvish commoners were dragged down into poverty, desperately struggling to survive, even as the Elven Empire itself continued to grow and prosper.

After centuries of stability, the rule of the Elven nobility ended suddenly as their robotic servants developed sentience. Conflict broke out, and within hours, social order had collapsed completely as the Elven Empire began to evacuate their home worlds. The evacuation efforts focused on saving the wealthy and influential, whilst transportation within lower class districts were sabotaged, and anyone who attempted to reach an evacuation port without authorization was killed.

Desperate to survive, the remaining Elves tried to find a means of escape, knowing they couldn't hide out long on their former home worlds. Some desperate raids led by criminal gangs managed to overpower space port guards and seize evacuation ships or cargo ships, whilst other Elves turned to smuggling rings and other groups that had vessels independent of the Elven military. Taking to the skies in stolen, salvaged and improvised vessels, these Elves would form new gangs and apply their skills to raiding and scavenging in order to survive. 

The Dark Elves quickly adapted to life as raiders, honing their skills as warriors and scientists, applying the advanced technology of the old Elven Empire in dark and innovative ways. Their knowledge of toxins is almost unparalleled within the Sirius Sector, while their alchemists have also made some unique breakthroughs in reverse engineering the Battle Brotherâ€™s gene-mods.

Those who receive these enhancements can be made even more powerful than a Prime Brother, though they will be irreparably damaged in mind and body during the process. These innovations have allowed the Dark Elves to survive and prosper in Sirius, even when faced with larger and more united enemies who would prefer to see them hunted down and destroyed. 

How will your gang survive the dangers of Sirius?

spells.name: Psy-Adrenaline
spells.effect: Pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets Harassing Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Snake Bite
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hits with AP(1) and Lacerate.

spells.name: Raiding Drugs
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which friendly units get +1 to hit rolls in melee against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value:
var range = params.effect.attackType?.value ?? 24;
return (this.getWeaponCost({ attacks: 1.5, range }, { quality: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value }) - this.getWeaponCost({ attacks: 1.5, range }, { quality: 5 }))

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Art of Pain
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 6", which takes 2 hits with AP(2) and Deadly(3).

spells.name: Fade in the Dark
spells.effect: Pick up to three friendly units within 12", which get Stealth once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Holistic Suffering
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 9 hits.

specialRules.name: Strafing
specialRules.description: Once per activation, when this model moves through enemy units, pick one of them and attack it with this weapon as if it was shooting. This weapon may only be used in this way.

specialRules.name: Melee Shrouding Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Melee Shrouding.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Speed Boost
specialRules.description: Moves +2" when using Advance, and +4â€ when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Harassing
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after shooting or being in melee.

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: Infiltrate
specialRules.description: Counts as having Ambush, but may be deployed up to 1" away from enemy units.

specialRules.name: Melee Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's melee weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Piercing Hunter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Piercing Hunter.

specialRules.name: Regenerative Strength
specialRules.description: Place one marker on this model when it ignores a wound. When in melee, pick one of its weapons to get +X attacks, where X is the number of markers on it.

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls in melee when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Ruinous Frenzy
specialRules.description: Place one marker on this unit when it fully destroys an enemy unit. For each marker all models with this rule in this unit get +1 to hit rolls and +1 to defense rolls until the end of the game (up to a max. of +2).

specialRules.name: Furious Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Furious.

specialRules.name: Lacerate
specialRules.description: When attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.

specialRules.name: Harassing Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Harassing Boost.

specialRules.name: Precision Fighting Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units get +1 to hit rolls in melee against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Martial Prowess
specialRules.description: Once per game, if all models in this unit have this rule, it may be activated even if it had already activated this round (stops being fatigued when activated for the second time). Only up to half of the units in the army with this rule at the beginning of the game (rounding up) may use it in a single round.

specialRules.name: Courage Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get +1 to morale test rolls.

specialRules.name: Regeneration Buff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets Regeneration once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Melee Shrouding
specialRules.description: Enemies get -3" movement when trying to charge units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9â€ away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush canâ€™t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model must take X wounds before being killed. If a model with tough joins a unit without it, then it is removed last when the unit takes wounds. You must continue to put wounds on the tough model with most wounds in the unit until it is killed, before starting to put them on the next tough model (heroes must be assigned wounds last, even if already wounded).

specialRules.name: Piercing Hunter
specialRules.description: When this model shoots at enemies over 9" away, its weapons get AP(+1).

specialRules.name: Furious
specialRules.description: When charging, unmodified results of 6 to hit in melee deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Harassing Boost
specialRules.description: If most models in this unit have Harassing, they may move by up to 6" from Harassing (instead of only 3").

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Stealth
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule are shot from over 9" away, enemy units get -1 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds donâ€™t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.
